description: Flowchart illustrating the six main processes of digestion in sequence: Ingestion -
Diagram of the human digestive system showing all major organs of the alimentary canal and accessory organs.
Close-up diagram of the mouth showing teeth, tongue, and salivary glands.

Sequence diagram showing the process of swallowing from mouth to esophagus. It should illustrate the bolus moving, the epiglottis closing over the trachea, and peristalsis in the esophagus pushing the bolus towards the stomach.
Diagram of the stomach showing its different regions (fundus, body, pylorus) and sphincters (lower esophageal and pyloric).
Microscopic view of intestinal villi and microvilli, highlighting the increased surface area.
Flowchart showing the secretion of bile from liver/gallbladder and pancreatic juice from pancreas into the duodenum, and their combined action on chyme.
Diagram of the large intestine showing its different parts: cecum, appendix, ascending colon, transverse colon, descending colon, sigmoid colon, rectum, and anal canal.
